faqs.question: Kan utlendinger kjøpe eiendom i Spania?
faqs.answer: Yes. EU citizens and most non-EU nationals can purchase Spanish property without restrictions. The process requires a Spanish tax identification number (NIE), which takes 15-20 minutes to obtain. British, North American, Australian, and other international buyers routinely purchase Costa Blanca properties. Legal representation is recommended to navigate purchase contracts and documentation.

faqs.question: Hva koster det å kjøpe eiendom i Spania?
faqs.answer: Purchase costs in Spain typically total 6-8% of property price. Transfer tax ranges 3-4% depending on regional location (Murcia is 3%). Legal fees run €800-1,200. Notary fees approximately 0.5% of purchase price. Inspection and valuation costs €300-500. These costs should be calculated into your €319,900 budget when planning the investment.

faqs.question: Kan jeg få boliglån i Spania som utlending?
faqs.answer: Yes. Multiple Spanish banks offer mortgages to non-residents, typically at 3-4.5% rates for qualified buyers. Most lenders require 30-40% down payment (€96,000-€128,000 for this property). Documentation includes proof of income, credit history assessment, and property valuation. Some British and international lenders also finance Spanish property purchases.
